subject: Career
title: Reframing Experience for a New Field
description: A short lesson to help you apply Reframing Experience for a New Field.

hook.text: 'I managed a $2M restaurant budget' becomes 'I managed a $2M P&L.' Same fact, different industry language.

buildup.text: Every industry has its own vocabulary. Translating your experience into the new field's language is essential.

discovery.text: The skill is the same. The framing makes it relevant. 'Teaching' becomes 'training.' 'Selling' becomes 'business.

twist.text: Hiring managers often can't see cross-industry parallels. Your job is to draw the connection for them.

climax.text: Study job descriptions in your target field. Map your experience to their exact keywords.

punchline.text: Same skills, new language. Translation is the strategy.

quiz.question: Why is reframing experience important in career transitions?
options: Hiring managers can't always see cross-industry parallels
